questionTitle: The mausoleum is ____ by Thien Thu mountain, two towering columns and a vast expanse of water.
Put plants ____ a window so that they will get enough light.
Employers often require that candidates have not only a degree .
Richard Nixon had been a lawyer and ____ before he entered politics.
anwers: served in the Navy as an officer
the Navy had him as an officer
did service in the Navy as an officer

questionTitle: If one of the participants in a conversation wonders ____ no real communication has taken place.
anwers: what did the other person say
what was the other person saying

questionTitle: The salary of a bus driver is much higher ____.
anwers: in comparison with the salary of a teacher

questionTitle: Professional people expect ____ when it is necessary to cancel an appointment.
Sedimentary rocks are formed below the surface of the earth ____ very high temperatures and pressures.
Farmers look forward to ____ every summer.
anwers: be participating in the county fairs
have participated in the county fairs

questionTitle: Clipper ships were the swiftest sailing ships that ____ to sea and the most beautiful.
The ships had their days of ____in the 1840s and 1850s.
Tea loses its flavor quickly ____in the hold of a vessel.
Earl was one of the first American artists ____landscapes.
The crime rate has continued to rise in American cities despite efforts on the part of both government and private citizens to curb ____.
In 1778, he ____ to London to study with Benjamin West for four years.
